meanings.sent1: I can resell my old toys at the garage sale.
meanings.sent2: She decided to resell her bicycle after fixing it up.
meanings.sent3: After realizing he bought too many, he had to resell some of his comic books.
meanings.sent4: The idea to resell the antique furniture struck her as a great way to make extra money.
meanings.sent5: He made a business out of reselling vintage clothing online.

meanings.definition: To sell (something) back to the original seller.
meanings.sent1: The store allows customers to resell items they no longer want.
meanings.sent2: I had to resell the defective product to the manufacturer.
meanings.sent3: It was funny when she tried to resell the gift back to the person who gave it to her.
meanings.sent4: Reselling the concert tickets to the venue felt like a strange experience.
meanings.sent5: He had to resell the car to the dealership after discovering a major issue.

meanings.sent1: She decided to resell her handmade jewelry to a boutique.
meanings.sent2: He plans to resell the extra produce from his garden at the farmer's market.
meanings.sent3: The idea to resell the concert tickets to her friend seemed like a good solution.
meanings.sent4: Reselling the rare book to a collector brought in a good profit.
meanings.sent5: They resell refurbished electronics to customers looking for affordable options.
